name: Spined Thopter
text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Flying

editions.flavor:
"I appreciate the depravity of noble designs turned to devious ends."
—Tezzeret

"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage

"As it moved, the wurm's spines gathered up bits of flowstone, which took the shapes of dead villagers' heads. Each head spoke a single sound, but if taken together, they said, ‘Alas for the living.'"
—Dal myth of the wurm
Its spines act like the teeth of a saw, scoring distinctive marks in the vegetation of its territory.

name: Splendid Genesis
text: Shuffle all cards in the game together and deal them into three decks. The game continues with a new player.

editions.flavor: She discovered with great delight that one does not love one's children because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them. Gabriel Garciá Márquez

name: Splendid Reclamation
text: Return all land cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor:
"No matter how much a plane has suffered, there is a way to restore it."
—Nissa Revane

name: Splinter
text: Exile target artifact. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that artifact and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

text:
Trample
Splinterfright's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

name: Splintering Wind
text: {2}{G}: Splintering Wind deals 1 damage to target creature. Create a 1/1 green Splinter creature token. It has flying and "Cumulative upkeep {G}." When it leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to you and each creature you control. (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

name: Splinter Twin
text:
Enchant creature

editions.flavor: "I know just the person for that job."

name: Split Decision
text: Will of the council — Choose target instant or sorcery spell. Starting with you, each player votes for denial or duplication. If denial gets more votes, counter the spell. If duplication gets more votes or the vote is tied, copy the spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

name: Split-Tail Miko
text: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: "I wish there were no use for those with my talents. I wish that I could walk Kamigawa forgotten and unneeded, with no war wounds to heal and no broken bones to mend."

name: Splitting Headache
text:
Choose one —
• Target player discards two cards.
• Target player reveals his or her hand, you choose a card from it, then that player discards that card.

editions.flavor: All faeries delve for dreams. But not all wait for their victims to fall asleep.

name: Spoils of Victory
text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

X is the number of artifact and/or creature cards in an opponent's graveyard as you cast Spoils of War.
Distribute X +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.
